page.title: 03Skenfrith Castle
page.content: Skenfrith Castle,Grosmont Castle and White Castle were all controlled by the Crown during the reign of Henry II.Together they dominated the area between the Wye and the Black Mountains.They became known as 'The Three Castles' The castle at Skenfrith consists of a rectangular grassed area enclosed by a stone wall which is practically as high as it was originally.There is a drum tower at each corner plus one other tower in the middle of the west side.A round tower stands in the centre.There is evidence that the castle was surrounded on three sides by a 2.7m deep moat, the River Monnow forming protection on the east side. Most of the remains of the castle date from the first half of the thirteenth century.
